page.title: 14LIFE IN KINGSTON 1985
page.content: Kingston expanded in 1962 when the University of Sussex started.Now only infilling is permitted in this A.O.N.B 800 people occupy 270 dwellings;90% are owner occupied and 10% rented.Most households own at least one car.People are employed in a variety of ways, working in Lewes,Brighton and some in London.There is a village based policeman. The large acreage of arable fields is operated by farmers outside the village.There is a riding stable and a stud farm.A Playgroup is provided for young children.Five elected members of the Parish Council levy a 3.2p rate.Founded in 1920 the Women's Institute has 62 members. Outdoor leisure is manifested in cricket,tennis,football,horse-riding, walking and gardening.Cowslips and orchids are widespread,but Dutch elm disease has destroyed many trees.
